meanings.definition: A person who serves as an assistant to an abbot.
meanings.sent1: The subabbots helped the abbot with daily tasks.
meanings.sent2: The monastery had several subabbots assisting the head abbot.
meanings.sent3: The subabbots accidentally mixed up the abbot's robes, causing a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: In the monastery, the subabbots were the right-hand men of the abbot, always by his side.
meanings.sent5: The subabbots were like shadows to the abbot, always ready to assist.

meanings.definition: The office or position of a subabbot.
meanings.sent1: She aspired to hold the prestigious position of subabbots one day.
meanings.sent2: The subabbots' office was located next to the abbot's chambers.
meanings.sent3: The subabbots' office was decorated with quirky paintings, adding a touch of humor.
meanings.sent4: In the hierarchy of the monastery, the subabbots' office was a symbol of authority.
meanings.sent5: The subabbots' office buzzed with activity, always bustling with tasks to be done.
